text: The words of Amos, who was among the shepherds of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of King Uzziah of Judah and in the days of King Jeroboam son of Joash of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he said:
The Lord roars from Zion
    and utters his voice from Jerusalem;
the pastures of the shepherds wither,
    and the top of Carmel dries up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
For three transgressions of Damascus,
    and for four, I will not revoke the punishment,
because they have threshed Gilead
    with threshing sledges of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will send a fire on the house of Hazael,
    and it shall devour the strongholds of Ben-hadad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will break the gate bars of Damascus
    and cut off the inhabitants from the Valley of Aven
and the one who holds the scepter from Beth-eden,
    and the people of Aram shall go into exile to Kir,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
For three transgressions of Gaza,
    and for four, I will not revoke the punishment,
because they carried into exile entire communities,
    to hand them over to Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will send a fire on the wall of Gaza,
    and it shall devour its strongholds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will cut off the inhabitants from Ashdod
    and the one who holds the scepter from Ashkelon;
I will turn my hand against Ekron,
    and the remnant of the Philistines shall perish,
            says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
For three transgressions of Tyre,
    and for four, I will not revoke the punishment,
because they delivered entire communities over to Edom
    and did not remember the covenant of kinship.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will send a fire on the wall of Tyre,
    and it shall devour its strongholds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
For three transgressions of Edom,
    and for four, I will not revoke the punishment,
because he pursued his brother with the sword
    and cast off all pity;
he maintained his anger perpetually
    and kept his wrath forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will send a fire on Teman,
    and it shall devour the strongholds of Bozrah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
For three transgressions of the Ammonites,
    and for four, I will not revoke the punishment,
because they have ripped open pregnant women in Gilead
    in order to enlarge their territory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will kindle a fire against the wall of Rabbah,
    and it shall devour its strongholds,
with shouting on the day of battle,
    with a storm on the day of the whirlwind;
speaker: Narrator

text:
then their king shall go into exile,
    he and his officials together,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
For three transgressions of Moab,
    and for four, I will not revoke the punishment,
because he burned to lime
    the bones of the king of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will send a fire on Moab,
    and it shall devour the strongholds of Kerioth,
and Moab shall die amid uproar,
    amid shouting and the sound of the trumpet;
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will cut off the ruler from its midst
    and will kill all its officials with him,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
For three transgressions of Judah,
    and for four, I will not revoke the punishment,
because they have rejected the instruction of the Lord
    and have not kept his statutes,
but they have been led astray by the same lies
    after which their ancestors walked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will send a fire on Judah,
    and it shall devour the strongholds of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
For three transgressions of Israel,
    and for four, I will not revoke the punishment,
because they sell the righteous for silver
    and the needy for a pair of sandals—
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
they lay themselves down beside every altar
    on garments taken in pledge;
and in the house of their God they drink
    wine bought with fines they imposed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet I destroyed the Amorite before them,
    whose height was like the height of cedars
    and who was as strong as oaks;
I destroyed his fruit above
    and his roots beneath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also I brought you up out of the land of Egypt
    and led you forty years in the wilderness,
    to possess the land of the Amorite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I raised up some of your children to be prophets
    and some of your youths to be nazirites.
    Is it not indeed so, O people of Israel?
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you made the nazirites drink wine
    and commanded the prophets,
    saying, “You shall not prophesy.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So, I will press you down in your place,
    just as a cart presses down
    when it is full of sheaves.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
and those who are stout of heart among the mighty
    shall flee away naked on that day,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear this word that the Lord has spoken against you, O people of Israel, against the whole family that I brought up out of the land of Egypt:
speaker: Narrator

text:
You only have I known
    of all the families of the earth;
therefore I will punish you
    for all your iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do two walk together
    unless they have made an appointment?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Does a lion roar in the forest
    when it has no prey?
Does a young lion cry out from its den
    if it has caught nothing?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Does a bird fall into a snare on the earth
    when there is no trap for it?
Does a snare spring up from the ground
    when it has taken nothing?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is a trumpet blown in a city,
    and the people are not afraid?
Does disaster befall a city
    unless the Lord has done it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely the Lord God does nothing
    without revealing his secret
    to his servants the prophets.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Proclaim to the strongholds in Ashdod
    and to the strongholds in the land of Egypt,
and say, “Assemble yourselves on Mount Samaria,
    and see what great tumults are within it
    and what oppressions are in its midst.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
They do not know how to do right, says the Lord,
    those who store up violence and robbery in their strongholds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus says the Lord God:
An adversary shall surround the land
    and strip you of your defense,
    and your strongholds shall be plundered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus says the Lord: As the shepherd rescues from the mouth of the lion two legs or a piece of an ear, so shall the people of Israel who live in Samaria be rescued, with the corner of a couch and part of a bed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear and testify against the house of Jacob,
    says the Lord God, the God of hosts:
speaker: Narrator

text:
On the day I punish Israel for its transgressions,
    I will punish the altars of Bethel,
and the horns of the altar shall be cut off
    and fall to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will tear down the winter house as well as the summer house,
    and the houses of ivory shall perish,
and the great houses shall come to an end,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this word, you cows of Bashan
    who are on Mount Samaria,
who oppress the poor, who crush the needy,
    who say to their husbands, “Bring something to drink!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord God has sworn by his holiness:
    The time is surely coming upon you
when they shall take you away with hooks,
    even the last of you with fishhooks.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through breaches in the wall you shall leave,
    each one straight ahead,
    and you shall be flung out into Harmon,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
bring a thank offering of leavened bread
    and proclaim freewill offerings, publish them;
    for so you love to do, O people of Israel!
            says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I gave you cleanness of teeth in all your cities
    and lack of bread in all your places;
yet you did not return to me,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
so two or three towns wandered to one town
    to drink water and were not satisfied;
yet you did not return to me,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
I overthrew some of you
    as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah,
    and you were like a brand snatched from the fire;
yet you did not return to me,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the one who forms the mountains, creates the wind,
    reveals his thoughts to mortals,
makes the morning darkness,
    and treads on the heights of the earth—
    the Lord, the God of hosts, is his name!
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear this word that I take up over you in lamentation, O house of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fallen, no more to rise,
    is maiden Israel;
forsaken on her land,
    with no one to raise her up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord God:
The city that marched out a thousand
    shall have a hundred left,
and that which marched out a hundred
    shall have ten left.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord to the house of Israel:
Seek me and live,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but do not seek Bethel,
and do not enter into Gilgal
    or cross over to Beer-sheba,
for Gilgal shall surely go into exile,
    and Bethel shall come to nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord and live,
    or he will break out against the house of Joseph like fire,
    and it will devour Bethel, with no one to quench it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ah, you who turn justice to wormwood
    and bring righteousness to the ground!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one who made the Pleiades and Orion
    and turns deep darkness into the morning
    and darkens the day into night,
who calls for the water of the sea
    and pours it out on the surface of the earth,
the Lord is his name,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who makes destruction flash out against the strong,
    so that destruction comes upon the fortress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They hate the one who reproves in the gate,
    and they abhor the one who speaks the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore because you trample on the poor
    and take from them levies of grain,
you have built houses of hewn stone,
    but you shall not live in them;
you have planted pleasant vineyards,
    but you shall not drink their wine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I know how many are your transgressions
    and how great are your sins—
you who afflict the righteous, who take a bribe
    and push aside the needy in the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the prudent will keep silent in such a time,
    for it is an evil time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek good and not evil,
    that you may live,
and so the Lord, the God of hosts, will be with you,
    just as you have said.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hate evil and love good,
    and establish justice in the gate;
it may be that the Lord, the God of hosts,
    will be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus says the Lord, the God of hosts, the Lord:
In all the squares there shall be wailing,
    and in all the streets they shall say, “Alas! Alas!”
They shall call the farmers to mourning
    and those skilled in lamentation to wailing;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Woe to you who desire the day of the Lord!
    Why do you want the day of the Lord?
It is darkness, not light,
speaker: Narrator

text:
as if someone fled from a lion
    and was met by a bear
or went into the house and rested a hand against the wall
    and was bitten by a snake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is not the day of the Lord darkness, not light,
    and gloom with no brightness in it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate, I despise your festivals,
    and I take no delight in your solemn assemblies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even though you offer me your burnt offerings and grain offerings,
    I will not accept them,
and the offerings of well-being of your fatted animals
    I will not look upon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take away from me the noise of your songs;
    I will not listen to the melody of your harps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But let justice roll down like water
    and righteousness like an ever-flowing stream.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did you bring to me sacrifices and offerings the forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall take up Sakkuth your king and Kaiwan your star god, your images, which you made for yourselves;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore I will take you into exile beyond Damascus, says the Lord, whose name is the God of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to those who are at ease in Zion
    and for those who feel secure on Mount Samaria,
the notables of the first of the nations,
    to whom the house of Israel resorts!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
you who put far away the evil day
    and bring near a reign of violence?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to those who lie on beds of ivory
    and lounge on their couches
and eat lambs from the flock
    and calves from the stall,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who sing idle songs to the sound of the harp
    and like David improvise on instruments of music,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who drink wine from bowls
    and anoint themselves with the finest oils
    but are not grieved over the ruin of Joseph!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore they shall now be the first to go into exile,
    and the revelry of the loungers shall pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord God has sworn by himself
(says the Lord, the God of hosts):
I abhor the pride of Jacob
    and hate his strongholds,
    and I will deliver up the city and all that is in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: If ten people remain in one house, they shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a relative, one who burns it, takes up the body to bring it out of the house and says to someone in the innermost parts of the house, “Is anyone else with you?” the answer will come, “No.” Then the relative shall say, “Hush! We must not mention the name of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord commands,
    and he will shatter the great house to bits
    and the little house to pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do horses run on rocky crags?
    Does one plow the sea with oxen?
But you have turned justice into poison
    and the fruit of righteousness into wormwood,
speaker: Narrator

text:
you who rejoice in Lo-debar,
    who say, “Have we not by our own strength
    taken Karnaim for ourselves?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, I am raising up against you a nation,
    O house of Israel, says the Lord, the God of hosts,
and they shall oppress you from Lebo-hamath
    to the Wadi Arabah.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what the Lord God showed me: he was forming locusts at the time the latter growth began to sprout (it was the latter growth after the king’s mowings).
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they had finished eating the grass of the land, I said,
“O Lord God, forgive, I beg you!
    How can Jacob stand?
    He is so small!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord relented concerning this;
    “It shall not be,” said the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what the Lord God showed me: the Lord God was calling for judgment by fire, and it devoured the great deep and was eating up the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I said,
“O Lord God, cease, I beg you!
    How can Jacob stand?
    He is so small!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord relented concerning this;
    “This also shall not be,” said the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what he showed me: the Lord was standing beside a wall built with a plumb line, with a plumb line in his hand.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
the high places of Isaac shall be made desolate,
    and the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste,
    and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Amaziah, the priest of Bethel, sent to King Jeroboam of Israel, saying, “Amos has conspired against you in the very center of the house of Israel; the land is not able to bear all his words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus Amos has said,
‘Jeroboam shall die by the sword,
    and Israel must go into exile
    away from his land.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Amaziah said to Amos, “O seer, go, flee away to the land of Judah, earn your bread there, and prophesy there,
speaker: Narrator

text: but never again prophesy at Bethel, for it is the king’s sanctuary, and it is a temple of the kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Amos answered Amaziah, “I am no prophet nor a prophet’s son, but I am a herdsman and a dresser of sycamore trees,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Lord took me from following the flock, and the Lord said to me, ‘Go, prophesy to my people Israel.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Now therefore hear the word of the Lord.
You say, ‘Do not prophesy against Israel,
    and do not preach against the house of Isaac.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus says the Lord:
Your wife shall become a prostitute in the city,
    and your sons and your daughters shall fall by the sword,
    and your land shall be parceled out by line;
you yourself shall die in an unclean land,
    and Israel shall surely go into exile away from its land.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what the Lord God showed me: a basket of summer fruit.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The songs of the temple shall become wailings on that day,”
            says the Lord God;
“the dead bodies shall be many,
    cast out in every place. Be silent!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this, you who trample on the needy,
    and bring to ruin the poor of the land,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “When will the new moon be over
    so that we may sell grain,
and the Sabbath,
    so that we may offer wheat for sale?
We will make the ephah smaller and the shekel heavier
    and practice deceit with false balances,
speaker: Narrator

text:
buying the poor for silver
    and the needy for a pair of sandals
    and selling the sweepings of the wheat.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has sworn by the pride of Jacob:
Surely I will never forget any of their deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall not the land tremble on this account,
    and everyone mourn who lives in it,
and all of it rise like the Nile,
    and be tossed about and sink again, like the Nile of Egypt?
speaker: Narrator

text:
On that day, says the Lord God,
    I will make the sun go down at noon
    and darken the earth in broad daylight.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The time is surely coming, says the Lord God,
    when I will send a famine on the land,
not a famine of bread or a thirst for water,
    but of hearing the words of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall wander from sea to sea
    and from north to east;
they shall run to and fro, seeking the word of the Lord,
    but they shall not find it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On that day the beautiful young women and the young men
    shall faint for thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who swear by Ashimah of Samaria
    and say, “As your god lives, O Dan,”
and, “As the way of Beer-sheba lives”—
    they shall fall and never rise again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I saw the Lord standing beside the altar, and he said:
Strike the capitals until the thresholds shake
    and shatter them on the heads of all the people,
and those who are left I will kill with the sword;
    not one of them shall flee away,
    not one of them shall escape.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though they dig into Sheol,
    from there shall my hand take them;
though they climb up to heaven,
    from there I will bring them down.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though they hide themselves on the top of Carmel,
    from there I will search out and take them;
and though they hide from my sight at the bottom of the sea,
    there I will command the serpent, and it shall bite them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And though they go into captivity in front of their enemies,
    there I will command the sword, and it shall kill them;
and I will fix my eyes on them
    for harm and not for good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord, God of hosts,
he who touches the earth and it melts,
    and all who live in it mourn,
and all of it rises like the Nile
    and sinks again, like the Nile of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who builds his upper chambers in the heavens
    and founds his vault upon the earth,
who calls for the waters of the sea
    and pours them out upon the surface of the earth—
the Lord is his name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Are you not like the Cushites to me,
    O people of Israel? says the Lord.
Did I not bring Israel up from the land of Egypt
    and the Philistines from Caphtor and the Arameans from Kir?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eyes of the Lord God are upon the sinful kingdom,
    and I will destroy it from the face of the earth
    —except that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob,
            says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will command
    and shake the house of Israel among all the nations,
as one shakes with a sieve
    but no pebble shall fall to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword,
    who say, “Evil shall not overtake or meet us.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
On that day I will raise up
    the booth of David that is fallen
and repair its breaches
    and raise up its ruins
    and rebuild it as in the days of old,
speaker: Narrator

text:
in order that they may possess the remnant of Edom
    and all the nations who are called by my name,
    says the Lord who does this.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The time is surely coming, says the Lord,
    when the one who plows shall catch up with the one who reaps
    and the treader of grapes with the one who sows the seed;
the mountains shall drip sweet wine,
    and all the hills shall flow with it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will restore the fortunes of my people Israel,
    and they shall rebuild the ruined cities and inhabit them;
they shall plant vineyards and drink their wine,
    and they shall make gardens and eat their fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will plant them upon their land,
    and they shall never again be plucked up
    out of the land that I have given them,
            says the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator
